p: On the other hand, the allelopathic activity of the inland samples could be attributed to a mixture of bioactive compounds that were reported as allelochemicals such as vanillin, 4â€²,7-dihydroxyisoflavone, quercetin, caffeic, gallic, coumaric, and cinnamic acids ( Table 3). El-Shora and Abd El-Gawad [ 56] reported the allelopathic activity of caffeic, gallic, coumaric, and cinnamic acids on the growth of Cicer arietinum and revealed the induction of various antioxidant enzymes (superoxide dismutase, catalase, and peroxidase) as well as the reactive oxygen species (ROS) and lipid peroxidation in the treated plants.
